thread.title: BNY Mellon Wealth Management Names Sheryl Linck as a Senior Wealth Director

author: cnbc.com
title: BNY Mellon Wealth Management Names Sheryl Linck as a Senior Wealth Director

organizations.name: bny mellon wealth management’s wealth alliance

text:
PITTSBURGH--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- BNY Mellon Wealth Management has named Sheryl Linck as a Senior Wealth Director in Pittsburgh, PA. Linck will report to Managing Director Garrett Alton and will be working across the region focusing on growing BNY Mellon Wealth Management’s Wealth Alliance business. Linck will be engaging and leveraging teams in Pittsburgh, Cleveland and Chicago as appropriate to support this effort.
“We are excited to welcome Sheryl to the team as she is crucial to the expansion of our growing national practice. Based on her past experience, I am certain that she will expand our reach into new markets and to a broader client base,” said Paul Sari, Head of Wealth Alliance.
Linck has 27 years of industry experience. Prior to joining BNY Mellon Wealth Management, she spent 16 years with Mellon Capital Management in various distribution leadership roles and in the field covering institutional investors. She began her BNY Mellon career with Dreyfus in the retirement services division covering mega market defined contribution plans. Prior roles include experience in investment management, M&A and product strategy.
“Sheryl’s wealth of experience and industry knowledge has already made her a key addition to BNY Mellon Wealth Management and our Wealth Alliance business. I am confident that she will continue to grow and enhance our brand and we are excited to have her on board,” said Alton.
Linck received her undergraduate degree and M.B.A. from Duquesne University in Pittsburgh. She is certified in Negotiation from Harvard Law School.
ABOUT BNY MELLON WEALTH MANAGEMENT
BNY Mellon Wealth Management is a leading wealth manager. In 2017, it was ranked as a Top 10 U.S. Wealth Manager by Barron’s. It was also awarded Best Private Bank for Customer Service in the U.S. by Financial Times publications Professional Wealth Management and The Banker. The firm has more than two centuries of experience in providing services to clients who today include financially successful individuals and families, their family offices and business enterprises, planned giving programs, and endowments and foundations. It has $238 billion in total client assets, as of December 31, 2017, and an extensive network of offices in the U.S. and internationally. BNY Mellon Wealth Management, which provides investment management, custody, wealth and estate planning and private banking services, conducts business through various operating subsidiaries of The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation. For more information go to www.bnymellonwealth.com or follow us on Twitter @BNYMellonWealth.
ABOUT BNY MELLON
BNY Mellon is a global investments company dedicated to helping its clients manage and service their financial assets throughout the investment lifecycle. Whether providing financial services for institutions, corporations or individual investors, BNY Mellon delivers informed investment management and investment services in 35 countries and more than 100 markets. As of December 31, 2017, BNY Mellon had $33.3 trillion in assets under custody and/or administration, and $1.9 trillion in assets under management. BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, hold, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments. BNY Mellon is the corporate brand of The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation (NYSE: BK). Additional information is available on www.bnymellon.com .
